title: Dark Night of the Soul
description:
Dark Night of the Soul, 
by St. John of the Cross
translated E. Allison Peers

Dark Night of the Soul tells of the journey of the soul from the body to union with God. It happens during the night, which represents the hardships and difficulties the soul meets in detachment from the world and reaching the light of the union with the Creator. There are several steps in this night, related in successive stanzas. The main idea of the poem can be seen as the painful experience that people endure as they seek to grow in spiritual maturity and union with God.
